charges.charge_disposition: Motion to reduce sentence pursuant to 2014 Drug Guidelines Amendment 782 is granted and the defendants previously imposed sentence of imprisonment of 168 months is reduced to 138 months.  ORIGINAL SENTENCE: The dft is hereby committed to the custody of the US Bur of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 168 months on Count 1. The dft is remanded to custody of the US Marshal. Upon release from imprisonment, the dft shall be on supervised release for a t erm of 5 yrs. The dft shall pay the following total financial penalties: $50.00 MSA; $2,000.00 FINE. The Court adopts the factual findings &; guideline application in the presentence report except: As findings of fact and sentencing guidelin e calculations the court adopts the uncontested portion of the presentence report &; the contested role in the offense enhancement, but otherwise accepts, for sentencing purposes, the objections to the report made by dft. A review of uncontested porti ons of the report shows that dft had the leading role in the offense, even assuming Luis Hernandez had a role greater than he admits. The sentence is w/in the guideline range, that range does not exceed 24 months, and the sentence is imposed for the following reasons(s): A mid-range sentence is appropirate because the drug trafficking admittedly was more extensive, in time than that for which dft is being held accountable, doubtless was more extensive in amount than the sum used for guideline ca lculations, &; dfts threats do not commend him for lenient treatment.
Hereby dismisses the indictment filed January 27, 1994, for the reason that a superseding indictment was returned March 23, 1994
Hereby dismisses the indictment filed January 27, 1994, for the reason that a superseding indictment was returned March 23, 1994

The dft is hereby committed to custody of the US Bur of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 96 months on Count 1 of Superseding Indictment. The dft is remanded to the custody of the US Marshall. Upon release from imprisonment, the dft shall be on supervised release for a term of 4 yrs as to Count 1 of Superseding Indictment. The dft shall pay the following total financial penalties: $50.00 MSA; $1,000.00 Fine. The Court adopts the factual findings &; guideline application in the pres entence report except: As findings of fact and sentencing guideline calculations the court adopts the presentence report except that for sentencing purposes the court accepts dft's objections, which do not affect the sentencing guidelines. The s entence is w/in the guideline range, that range exceeds 24 months, and the sentence is imposed for the following reason(s): A mid-range sentence is deemed appropriate because the full extent of the drug trafficking is probably not reflected in amount s for which dft is being held responsible and because dft's role is probably being unduly minimized by him, as indicated in part by use of dft's place of business as the focal point for the transactions.
Hereby dismisses the indictment filed January 27, 1994 for the reason that a superseding indictment was returned March 23, 1994.
Hereby dismisses the indictment filed January 27, 1994 for the reason that a superseding indictment was returned March 23, 1994.
Count 5 of the Superseding Indictment filed 8/17/94 is dismissed on the motion of the US.

The dft is hereby committed to the custody of the US Bur of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 87 months on Count 1 of Superseding Indictment. The dft David G. Hernandez, shall surrender to the institution designated by the Bur of Prisons on Augu st 31, 1994 and in the absence of designation, at the office of the US Marshall before 2:00 p.m. Upon release from imprisonment, the dft shall be on supervised release for a term of 4 yrs as to Count 1 of Superseding Indictment. The dft shall pay the following total financial penalties: $50.00 MSA; $1,000.00 FINE. The Court adopts the factual findings &; guideline application in the presentence report except: As findings of fact &; sentencing guideline calculations the court adopts the p resentence report. Dft's involvement in the firearms aspect of the case is similar to that of the codefendants, who do not contest the enhancement. Even if the firearms had a dual purpose, they are part of the drug offense. The court disagrees w /the probation officer's analysis of the criminal history calculation, based on the presentation made at the hearing and will use Category I for Criminal History. The sentence is w/in the guideline range, that range exceeds 24 months, and the se ntence is imposed for the following reason(s): Sentencing at the bottom of the Guidelines reflects dft's more limited role in the offense and is deemed adequate for punishment &; deterrence.
Hereby dismisses the indictment dated January 27, 1994 for the reason that a superseding indictment was returned March 23, 1994.
Hereby dismisses the indictment dated January 27, 1994 for the reason that a superseding indictment was returned March 23, 1994.
